Header: 26th Annual Sessions of Medical Administrators Association held under patronage of the Health Minister
Content: The twenty-sixth Annual Sessions of the Medical Administrators Association was held under the patronage of Minister Rajitha Senaratne The twenty-sixth Annual Sessions of the Medical Administrators Association was held under the patronage of Minister Rajitha Senaratne. Four doctors who presented new research reports came in for acclamation. It was organized by the Medical Administrators Association for the 26th occasion. Doctors who presented creative new research reports on behalf of upgrading the medical field came in for appreciation. Merit certificates and prizes were awarded by Minister Rajitha Senaratne. A group of officials including President of the Medical Administrators Association Consultant Dr. Sujatha Senaratne joined in the occasion. In the meantime, Japan has decided to hand over sum of 20,000 million rupees on behalf of upgrading the health sector in Sri Lanka. Japanâ€™s Ambassador to Sri Lanka Akira Sugiyama has made this intimation to Minister Rajitha Senaratne. The Japanese Ambassador intimated to the Health Minister when he met him. He also told the Health Minister that measures will be taken to provide a Theatre with all modern facilities before the year 2020. Minister Rajitha Senaratne lauded the support extended by Japan to upgrade health sector in Sri Lanka.
